description: Variation of Condition 3 to retrospectively alter the materials used for the enclosure of wall-mounted ductwork, following planning approval 01225/24/S12 dated 14/12/2018 for Relocation of rooftop plant ductwork approved under 01225/24/S11 to side elevation and installation of visual screening.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of original permission 01225/24/S12 dated 14/12/2018.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (P105 received: 23/07/2019. Drawings approved under 01225/24/P12: P100 received: 29/10/2018. Design and Access Statement, P110 Rev P1, P120 Rev P1, P210 Rev P2, and P220 Rev P2, and Plant Noise Assessment April 2018 received: 13/12/2018) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the approved documents from original permission 01225/24/S12 dated 14/12/2018, the proposed wall-mounted ductwork shall be enclosed in "Soho XL Architectural Expanded Metal" in Anodised RAL 1002 (Sand Yellow), and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Condition : 4 - No installation or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 08:00 to 18:00 on Mondays to Friday and 09:00 to 13:00 on Saturdays, and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Condition : 5 - The proposal shall be in full compliance with submitted Plant Noise Assessment Plan.

Condition : 6 - a) The cumulative measured or calculated rating level of noise emitted from the mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, shall be 10dB(A) below the existing background noise level, at all times that the mechanical system etc operates. The measured or calculated noise levels shall be determined at the boundary of the nearest ground floor noise sensitive premises or 1 meter from the facade of the nearest first floor (or higher) noise sensitive premises, and in accordance to the latest British Standard 4142; An alternative position for assessment /measurement may be used to allow ease of access, this must be shown on a map and noise propagation calculations detailed to show how the design criteria is achieved. 
b) The plant shall be isolated on adequate proprietary anti-vibration mounts to prevent the structural transmission of vibration and regenerated noise within adjacent or adjoining premises, and these shall be so maintained thereafter.   
c) Following installation of any mechanical services plant including heating, ventilation and air conditioning (HVAC) to which the application refers, a post completion noise assessment shall be submitted for approval to the local planning authority which demonstrates the actual measured rating level of plant operating under normal conditions. All measurements shall be made in accordance with the methodology of BS4142: 2014 (Methods for rating and assessing industrial and commercial sound) and/or its subsequent amendments. The post completion report shall be both completed and submitted to the local authority within 28 days of completion of the installation for review.
